fields.Title of Contribution: An Exploration of Professional Values Held By Nurses at a Large Freestanding Pediatric Hospital
fields.Description/Abstract: Professional values form the basis for nurse attitudes and behavior and are a cornerstone to guiding nurses’ clinical practice decisions. The purpose of this descriptive study of nurses at a large children’s hospital is to describe the professional values of employed registered nurses and describe differences based on demographic characteristics (age, generation, years of experience, education, professional role). This study is based on Benner’s (1984) theoretical framework of novice to expert. The Nurses’ Professional Values Scale: Revised (NPVS-R) (2004) was administered to working RNs at the children’s hospital. Data analysis in this study demonstrates that nurses’ professional values were statistically significantly different based upon education, generation, job classification, and years of nursing experience. Further research is warranted to explore the interaction between professional values and demographic characteristics over time within complex healthcare systems.
